in the eyes of: In the eys of other people means in another person's opinion.
mutually exclusive: If two things are mutually exclusive, they are separate and very different from each other, so that it is impossible for them to exist or happen together.
set out to: To set out to do something is to begin doing something that is part of a plan.
a mass of: A mass of things is a large number of them grouped together.
amount to: If something amounts to a particular total, all the parts of it add up to that total.
at the cost of: If something is done at the cost of another thing, it is made possible with the loss of that thing.
press into service: If you press something into service, you use that for an unusual purpose.
accuse of: If you accuse someone of doing something wrong or dishonest, you say or tell them that you believe that they did it.
in practice: What happens in practice is what actually happens, in contrast to what is supposed to happen.
subordinate to: If you subordinate something to another thing, you regard it or treat it as less important than the other thing.
